concept.title: Importing Docker Images into a Local Registry

p.note: This section is relevant only if you are installing the Docker images from tar.gz files, not directly from DockerHub.

section.p: In order to install Docker images from archive files, you need access to a local Docker registry:

Make sure you have command-line access with write permissions to the Docker registry server in your network. If this is not available, you may choose to install such a server in your target environment. Refer to the Docker documentation at
https://docs.docker.com/registry/deploying for details on how to deploy a Docker registry server.
In the subsequent sections, this registry is referred to as ${REGISTRY}.

p.note: The name of the default DockerHub registry is servicecatalog.

ol.li: On your Docker machine, copy the Docker image archive files into the /opt folder.

Import the images into your Docker registry using the following Docker command bash script:
#!/bin/bash
export REGISTRY=<docker registry service>
docker login ${REGISTRY}
for docker_image in \ oscm-deployer \ oscm-core \ oscm-app \ oscm-core \ oscm-birt \ oscm-db \ oscm-help \ oscm-initdb \ ; do
docker load â€“i /opt/${docker_image}.tar.gz
docker tag ${REGISTRY}/${docker_image}:v18
docker push ${REGISTRY}/${docker_image}:v18
done
